title: Alvaro Morata pleads innocence during angry confrontation with Spanish media after red card
text:
Alvaro Morata is still furious with his sending off against Mallorca and had to be restrained when conducting an interview about the incident.

The striker was shown red for a confrontation with Xisco Campos and the referee during his side's 2-0 win and was still fuming long after the final whistle.

When questioned about the incident he aggressively retorted: 'Let Xisco Campos say it if he has balls, I did nothing.'

Scroll down for video...

Alvaro Morata gave an impassioned defence of his actions as he confronted the media

Morata put his head towards Xisco Campos and was then shown his second yellow card

The striker had to be restrained by staff and the club are going to appeal his sending off

It seems the Spaniard is claiming that he was provoked by something Campos said to him.

Morata's defence was so impassioned that he had to be restrained and led away by a member of Atletico staff.

The former Chelsea man was shown one yellow card just two minutes before the second on Wednesday night.

Morata was furious at the time of the incident and still hadn't calmed down after the game

Morata leaned towards the journalist asking the question and seemed to lose his cool

He moved his head towards Campos and had too much to say to the referee, meaning the official had no option to book him again.

Diego Costa and Joao Felix scored the goals to put Diego Simeone's side on top of La Liga.

And it could be a costly suspension for Morata, who may now miss the derby against former side Real Madrid.

Atletico are going to appeal the sending off, when the ban is officially issued. They want the second yellow shown by Alejandro Hernandez to be revoked.

If successful, Morata would be available to play against Real on Saturday.
description: Alvaro Morata is still furious with his sending off against Mallorca and had to be restrained when conducting an interview about the incident.
